snippet: Reported government plans to give intelligence services the ability to monitor the electronic communications of every person in the country drew fire on Monday.
abstract: British lawmakers and rights activists join a chorus of protests against plans by the government to give the intelligence and security services the ability to monitor phone calls, e-mails, text messages and Internet use of every person in the country.
lead_paragraph: Reported government plans to give intelligence services the ability to monitor the electronic communications of every person in the country drew fire on Monday.

headline.main: Britons Protest Proposal to Widen Surveillance
headline.print_headline: Britons Protest Proposal To Widen Surveillance
